description: [Status: stable] [Name: pytest-extraneous-scope-function] [Message: scope='function' is implied in @pytest.fixture()] What it does Checks for pytest.fixture calls with scope="function". Why is this bad? scope="function" can be omitted, as it is the default. Example import pytest @pytest.fixture(scope="function") def my_fixture(): ... Use instead: import pytest @pytest.fixture() def my_fixture(): ...
